results.title: Black ash
results.brief_description: An account of a typical ‘lazy day’ by the river in Warburton which suddenly turns nasty when Bonnie and her friends realise the gravity of the fire. She recounts her anxiety and wanting to leave Warburton and her frustration at her family’s indecisions. She is stuck in Lysterfield after they evacuate with 17 people.

results.title: Voula Messimeri-Kianidis
results.creator_credit: Helen Simondson, Lisetta Moscardo and ACMI
results.brief_description: Voula Messimeri-Kianidis is the current Chair for the Federation of Ethnic Communities’ Councils of Australia (FECCA) an Honour Roll inductee and Member of the Order of Australia (AM). She co-founded the Victorian Immigrant and Refugee Women’s Coalition (VIRWC) and has served as Chair of the Immigrant Women’s Domestic Violence Service, as Inaugural Chair of the Women in the North Service, as Council member at the RMIT University, as well as on a number of State and Federal advisory and policy structures.

results.title: A Day to remember
results.brief_description: A young CFA volunteer who spent her 21st birthday on duty during the bushfires of February 2009. Her entire family is involved in the CFA as volunteer firefighters. She speaks about the poignancy of seeing an Australian flag on a resident’s home during ‘Black Saturday’.

results.title: Dr Isabel Joy Bear
results.creator_credit: Helen Simondson, Lisetta Moscardo and ACMI
results.brief_description: Isabel Joy Bear began her extensive career in science in the 1940s and today is an Honorary Fellow with CSIRO Minerals. In the 1960s Bear discovered a number of previously unknown metastable zirconium sulfate hydrates. Joy was appointed a Member of the Order of Australia in 1986 for services to science, particularly in the field of mineral chemistry. She is a fellow of both the Royal Australian Chemical Institute (RACI) and the Australasian Institute of Mining and Metallurgy, and in 1988 became the first woman to receive the Leighton Medal - the RACI’s premier award.

Joy was appointed a Member of the Order of Australia in 1986 for services to science, particularly in the field of mineral chemistry. results.title: Game Masters: Paulina Bozek interview
results.creator_credit: Jim Arneman, ACMI Content Development, ACMI Media Studio and ACMI
results.brief_description:
Paulina Bozek started her career at Ubisoft in Montreal, Canada, before moving to Sony as the Executive Producer of the ‘SingStar’ franchise for PlayStation. Currently she is CEO and co-founder at INENSUA, responsible for overseeing the creative direction and team management for the development of social games and applications. A self-confessed casual gamer, Paulina studied film and communication and has always been interested in pop culture and the combination of technology and entertainment. In this interview she discusses her preference for working on long term projects, as well as the importance of user feedback and engaging the audience early in the development process.

In this interview Paulina talks about ‘SingStar’, ‘Closet Swap’ and her new project ‘Super Fan’. NB: Interviewer is neither seen nor heard onscreen.

results.title: Judy Maddigan
results.creator_credit: Helen Simondson, Lisetta Moscardo and ACMI
results.brief_description: Judy Maddigan was the first woman Deputy Speaker and was the first woman to be appointed the Speaker of The Legislative Assembly in Victoria in 2003. Maddigan has a strong commitment to community and was elected as a Member of Parliament to represent the Electoral District of Essendon in the Legislative Assembly in 1996. During her time as speaker Maddigan implemented many changes in the 150 year old parliament to improve the lives of workers and also public accessibility. She is a librarian at heart and is currently the Member for Essendon.

She is a librarian at heart and is currently the Member for Essendon.

results.title: Into the flames
results.brief_description: A personal account of ‘Black Saturday’ bushfires from a young leader, a volunteer from CFA Region 14. Simon speaks of his experiences fighting the blaze - monitoring where campers are located, through to anger from local residents directed at his crew in the heat and panic of the fires.

results.title: Lecki Ord
results.creator_credit: Helen Simondson, Lisetta Moscardo and ACMI
results.brief_description: Lecki Ord has an extensive career of community involvement and town planning and is a veteran campaigner for sustainable living. She has long been leading the way for women entering fields dominated predominantly by men since starting out as an architect in the 1960s. In 1987 Ord became the first female Lord Mayor of Melbourne and in 1995 became a founding member of the Women’s Planning Network.

results.title: Hollywood Costume: What is Costume Design? with Prof. D. Nadoolman Landis
results.creator_credit: Mike Kenneally, Kim Montgomery, Richard Greenhalgh and ACMI

video_links.name: Hollywood Costume: What is Costume Design? with Prof. D. Nadoolman Landis

results.brief_description:
In a special event held at ACMI as part of the ‘Hollywood Costume’ exhibition, curator Professor Deborah Nadoolman Landis introduced the art of costume design and discussed its role in cinematic storytelling.
Landis, an Oscar®-nominated Hollywood costume designer (‘Raiders of the Lost Ark’, ‘The Blues Brothers’, Michael Jackson’s ‘Thriller’) is also the author of ‘Hollywood Costume’ (2012), the prize-winning exhibition catalogue, and ‘Hollywood Sketchbook: A Century of Costume Illustration’ (2012) among many other volumes.
Landis received her Ph.D. from the Royal College of Art in London and is the Founding Director of the David C. Copley Center for Costume Design at the UCLA School of Theater, Film and Television.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Mike Kenneally, Kim Montgomery, Richard Greenhalgh and ACMI
